data_table.description: Outcomes - Stroke/Carotid Artery Disease (Form 121/132). Note: The rel# in the file name is used by the submitter to track embargo releases. Files that have "rel2" or later may either contain additional variables or more recent data as compared to the previous rel#. There will not be a "rel3" file.

variable.name: CAROTID
variable.comment: Carotid Artery Disease was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. In Ext2 it is only adjudicated for the Medical Record Cohort. Carotid Artery Disease occurring on or after a Stroke is not counted.

variable.name: STRKHEMO
variable.comment: Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates a hemorrhagic stroke. It was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. In Ext2 it is only adjudicated for the Medical Record Cohort. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes.

variable.name: STRKISCH
variable.comment: Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates an iscemic stroke. Ischemic Stroke was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. In Ext2 it is only adjudicated for the Medical Record Cohort. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes.

variable.name: STROKE
variable.comment: Defined as the first occurence of Stroke or a Death due to Cerebrovascular. Stroke was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. In Ext2 it is only adjudicated for the Medical Record Cohort. In order to be able to classify strokes, WHI uses central adjudications if possible, even though Strokes were only fully centrally adjudicated in HT participants.

variable.name: STROKEDX
variable.comment: Value 6 was only on form 121 and early versions of form 132. Strokes with a diagnosis code of 6 were unable to be classified as Hemorrhagic or Ischemic.
variable.value: Central nervous system complications during/from procedure

variable.name: STROKEPROC
variable.description: Stroke occurred during or resulted from a procedure
variable.comment: Not collected on early versions of F132. A stroke is defined as procedure-related if it occurs within 24 hours after any procedure or within 30 days after a cardioversion or invasive cardiovascular procedure.

variable.name: STROKEOUTPAT
variable.description: F132 Stroke diagnosed or managed as outpatient
variable.comment:
Was the stroke diagnosed or managed as an outpatient?* _x000D_
*The outpatient setting includes any emergency department or observation unit, short hospital stays of less than 24 hours duration or a direct admission to a rehab facility without an associated admission to an acute care hospital. Only collected after WHI closeout.

variable.name: STROKETOAST
variable.comment: Trial of Org 10172 in Acute Stroke Treatment (TOAST) Classification A 'probable' diagnosis is made if the clinical findings, neuroimaging data, and results of diagnostic studies are consistent with one subtype and other etiologies have been excluded. A 'possible' diagnosis is made when the clinical findings and neuroimaging data suggest a specific subtype but other studies are not done.
variable.value: Probable stroke of other determined etiology
Possible Stroke of other determined etiology
Stroke undetermined two or more causes identified

variable.name: STROKEBASE
variable.value: Rapid neuro deficit &CT/MRI lesion & w/o evid. of blood
Rapid neuro deficit duration >= 24 hrs & rad n/a
Rapid neuro deficit duration >= 24hrs & rad early no acute
CT or MRI blood hemor. in subarachnoid or intra-parenchymal

variable.name: STROKE28DEATH
variable.description: Hospitalized stroke within 28 days of death
variable.comment: If stroke fatal: Hospitalized stroke within 28 days of death

variable.name: STROKEPREV
variable.description: Previous stroke and no other lethal disease
variable.comment: If stroke fatal: Previous stroke and no known potentially lethal non-cerebrovascular disease process

variable.name: STROKEPOSTMORT
variable.comment: If stroke fatal: Stroke diagnosed as cause of death at post-mortem examination

variable.name: STROKEDEATHCERT
variable.comment: If stroke fatal: Stroke listed as underlying cause of death on death certificate

variable.name: STROKEGLASGOW
variable.comment: Participant's functional status at the time of discharge (Glasgow Outcome Scale)

variable.name: CARDX
variable.comment: Collected on all versions of form 121, only collected on form 132 after WHI closeout.
variable.value: Occlusion/stenosis w/o documentation of cerebral infarction
Occlusion/stenosis w documentation of cerebral infarcation

variable.name: CARBHOSP
variable.description: Carotid artery disease based on hosp discharge
variable.comment: Carotid artery disease based on: Symptomatic disease with carotid artery disease listed on the hospital discharge summary Collected on all versions of form 121, only collected on form 132 after WHI closeout.

variable.name: CARBABNORMAL
variable.description: Carotid artery disease based on abnormal findings
variable.comment: Carotid artery disease based on: Symptomatic disease with abnormal findings (>= 50% stenosis) on carotid angiogram, MRA, or Doppler flow study Collected on all versions of form 121, only collected on form 132 after WHI closeout.

variable.name: CARBPROC
variable.description: Carotid artery disease based on vasc/surg proc.
variable.comment: Carotid artery disease based on: Vascular or surgical procedure to improve flow to the ipsilateral brain. Collected on all versions of form 121, only collected on form 132 after WHI closeout.
